item.title: Maggie add a quote by Astrid Lindgren
item.description: "Give the children love, more love and still more love â€“ and the common sense will come by itself." -- Astrid Lindgren

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "The arc of the moral universe is long, but it bends towards justice." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Malcolm Muggeridge
item.description: "The depravity of man is at once the most empirically verifiable reality but at the same time the most intellectually resisted fact." -- Malcolm Muggeridge

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "All I am is literature, and I am not able or willing to be anything else." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Louise Penny
item.description: "Where there is love there is courage, where there is courage there is peace, where there is peace there is God. And when you have God, you have everything." -- Louise Penny

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Torquato Tasso
item.description: "Any time not spent on love is wasted." -- Torquato Tasso

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "You are not entitled to your opinion. You are entitled to your <i>informed</i> opinion. No one is entitled to be ignorant." -- Harlan Ellison

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "The two most common elements in the universe are Hydrogen and stupidity." -- Harlan Ellison

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "I know that pain is the most important thing in the universes. Greater than survival, greater than love, greater even than the beauty it brings about. For without pain, there can be no pleasure. Without sadness, there can be no happiness. Without misery there can be no beauty. And without these, life is endless, hopeless, doomed and damned. Adult. You have become adult." -- Harlan Ellison

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "I don't mind you thinking I'm stupid, but don't talk to me like I'm stupid" -- Harlan Ellison

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "If you make people think they're thinking, they'll love you; but if you really make them think, they'll hate you." -- Harlan Ellison

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "The world is turning into a cesspool of imbeciles." -- Harlan Ellison

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "Like a wind crying endlessly through the universe, Time carries away the names and the deeds of conquerors and commoners alike. And all that we were, all that remains, is in the memories of those who cared we came this way for a brief moment." -- Harlan Ellison

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "In these days of widespread illiteracy, functional illiteracy... anything that keeps people stupid is a felony." -- Harlan Ellison

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "Don't start an argument with somebody who has a microphone when you don't. They'll make you look like chopped liver." -- Harlan Ellison

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Harlan Ellison
item.description: "The only thing worth writing about is people. People. Human beings. Men and women whose individuality must be created, line by line, insight by insight. If you do not do it, the story is a failure. [...] There is no nobler chore in the universe than holding up the mirror of reality and turning it slightly, so we have a new and different perception of the commonplace, the everyday, the 'normal', the obvious. People are reflected in the glass. The fantasy situation into which you thrust them is the mirror itself. And what we are shown should illuminate and alter our perception of the world around us. Failing that, you have failed totally." -- Harlan Ellison

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "I write differently from what I speak, I speak differently from what I think, I think differently from the way I ought to think, and so it all proceeds into deepest darkness." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "All language is but a poor translation." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "Youth is happy because it has the capacity to see beauty. Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "I am free and that is why I am lost." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "You do not need to leave your room. Remain sitting at your table and listen. Do not even listen, simply wait, be quiet, still and solitary. The world will freely offer itself to you to be unmasked, it has no choice, it will roll in ecstasy at your feet." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "I am a cage, in search of a bird." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "By believing passionately in something that still does not exist, we create it. The nonexistent is whatever we have not sufficiently desired." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "Now I can look at you in peace; I don't eat you any more." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "Paths are made by walking" -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "The meaning of life is that it stops." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "I do not speak as I think, I do not think as I should, and so it all goes on in helpless darkness." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "Love is a drama of contradictions." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "The true way goes over a rope which is not stretched at any great height but just above the ground. It seems more designed to make people stumble than to be walked upon." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Maggie add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "You can hold yourself back from the sufferings of the world, that is something you are free to do and it accords with your nature, but perhaps this very holding back is the one suffering you could avoid." -- Franz Kafka
